newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - August 23.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - August 23.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Friday:

** Indonesian opposition figurehead Megawati Sukarnoputri is working on a deal with the government to end the row over her ouster from the Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI), a senior judge said on Thursday.

** The Dow Jones industrial average rose 43.65 points to 5,733.47 on Thursday, putting the index less than 45 points from its record closing high of 5,778.00 set on May 22, following a steep cut in German interest rates that also bolstered share prices across Europe.
** The Bundesbank, Germany's central bank, decided to slash its main money market interest rate to a historic low of 3.00 percent from 3.30 percent.

There was speculation that the German move, which was quickly followed by other central banks in European and Canada, might take some of the pressure off the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates in the coming months.

** The Jakarta composite index rose 2.08 points, or 0.38 percent, to close at 544.28 points on Thursday on the back of foreign buying and active secondaries as the country's political tensions appeared to ease somewhat.
** On Friday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,341.25/41.75 in early trading against an opening of 2,341.50/42.50.
** Telkom on an announcement that it has successfully completed negotiations with four joint operators of telephone lines about revenue payments.
** Jembo Cable on market talk of possible acquisitions.
** Packaging manufacturer Super Indah Makmur on announcement of tender offer by PT VDH Teguh Sakti, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Singapore-listed Van Der Horst.
** Privately-owned Bank Duta on market talk it is obtaining fresh syndicated loans, the likelihood of a management resuffle and fresh equity injection.
